AMST428F: Myth and Memory 1985

Links to helpful for locating primary sources from 1985 in the UMD Libraries.
  • AMST428F: Myth and Memory 1985

Requesting Materials from Special Collections and University Archives

  

Once you have a Special Collections Research Account, you may request Special Collections and University Archives material online or in the Maryland Room from any computer.  

To request materials from the online catalog:

  • Click on the 'Request from Special Collections' link located in the catalog record.
  • You will be prompted to sign in to your Special Collections Research Account.  Don't have an account? You can register online.
  • Once you sign in, a request page will appear with the item's information. Verify that the information is correct.  Please be sure to note any volume or issue numbers you would like to see.
    • Do you want to request copies instead of requesting to view the materials in the reading room? Select 'Switch to Reproductions Order' at the top and fill out the form.
  • Schedule your visit by selecting what day you would like to come to the reading room to view the item.
  • Click on the 'Submit Request' link to send your request to special collections staff. You can monitor the status of your request online using your Aeon account. 

To request materials from an archival finding aid:

  • Click on the 'Request from Special Collections' link located in the finding aid.
  • You will be prompted to sign into your Special Collections Research Account. Don't have an account? You will be able to register online.
  • Once you sign in, a request page will appear.  Select which boxes you would like to view in the reading room. 
    • Do you want to request copies instead of requesting to view the materials in the reading room? Select 'Switch to Reproductions Order' at the top and fill out the form.
  • Schedule your visit by selecting what day you would like to come to the reading room to view the materials.
  • Click on the 'Submit Request' link to send your request to special collections staff. You can monitor the status of your request online using your research account. 

Tips

  • You may request up to 15 books or boxes  at a time. Need more? Don't worry, you can make additional requests when you visit the reading room.
  • You can check the status of your requests from your Special Collections Research Account, and verify that materials have been placed on hold before your visit to the reading room.

Getting started

Getting Started

Use the links in this guide to view materials online or to select materials to be used in the Maryland Room in Hornbake Library. Before you arrive to do your research, consider setting up a user account.

After setting up your account, you can request materials in advance of your arrival. Contact us anytime for assistance with your project.

Resources available on campus

University Publications

University Publications consist of a wide variety of printed materials produced by and about the various administrative units, academic departments, student groups, and athletic teams on the College Park campus.

Selected resources

  • 1984/85 Yearbook
  • 1985/86 Yearbook
  • 1984/85 Course Catalog
  • 1985/86 Course Catalog
  • 1985 (May) Commencement program
  • 1985 (December) Commencement program
  • 1984/85 Student Handbook
  • 1985/86 Student Handbook
  • Budget with salary detail
    Available in Hornbake Library
    UPUB B7.001
  • 1985 Football Media Guide
  • Football programs
    Available in Hornbake Library
    UPUB I11.017
  • 1985/86 Men's basketball media guide

Archival resources

  • College Park Campus Senate
    From 1971 - 1993, the legislative powers of the College Park campus system of governance were vested in the College Park Campus Senate. Senate membership is composed of elected representatives from all four segments of the campus community: administration, faculty, staff, and students. The records of the College Park Campus Senate consist of material generated by the Campus Senate in carrying out its duties. The records include agendas, minutes, correspondence, reports, bylaws, and newspaper clippings.
  • Chancellor's Office files
    The records consist of the administrative files of the Chancellor and include reports, financial and budget records, committee and task force files, publications, and working papers. Among the topics covered are: College Park campus academic and administrative organization, athletic programs, human relations, UMCP/Vietnam War years, student affairs, faculty affairs, budget and budget process, computers and computer applications, UMCP/State of Maryland relations, UMCP/United States government relations.
    Records for 1985 are unprocessed. Review the attached inventories and request material in advance of your visit to allow time for screening.
  • Chancellor's Office - Inventory 1
  • Chancellor's Office - Inventory 2
  • Chancellor's Office - Inventory 3
  • University Theater
    University Theater is the University of Maryland's student performance group, established in the 1950s. The collection documents the group's shows, plays, and musicals through event files, publicity materials, programs, invitations, brochures, posters, newspaper clippings, and scripts.
  • University Theater collection
  • Records of the Board of Regents
    The Board of Regents is the highest-level governing body of the University of Maryland system. The Regents' records document overall administration of the university. They contain correspondence; statements; proposals; reports; and files from specific committees, boards, and commissions, in particular the Committee on the Presidency, the Agricultural Advisory Board, and the Maryland Agricultural Commission.

    Meeting minutes are located in Series IV, Box 17
  • ArchivesUM
    Archival collections at the University of Maryland Libraries contain manuscripts, photographs, video and sound recordings, and other ephemera. ArchivesUM allows you to browse by subjects including agriculture, historic preservation, and railroad history. This is also where you will find records of campus buildings and development.

Photographs

The University Archives includes nearly one million images. Not everything has been digitized, so please contact us so that we might help you locate the appropriate resources for your project.

  • University AlbUM (Online)
    A collection of University of Maryland images in digital form. Other resources pertaining to University of Maryland history are located in the University Archives

Newspapers and magazines

Student newspapers and magazines

  • Diamondback
    Microfilm available in Hornbake and McKeldin libraries. Indexes exist for certain periods of time.
  • Black Explosion
    Student newspaper, published by the Black Student Union.
    Available in Hornbake Library. UPUB S36.015
  • Eclipse
    African-American oriented student newspaper.
    Available in Hornbake Library. UPUB 36.016
  • Mitzpeh
    Jewish student newspaper
    Available in Hornbake Library. UPUB S36.017
  • Calvert Review
    Student literary magazine
    Available in Hornbake Library. UPUB S36.003

Other newspapers

  • Baltimore News American
    Jan. 13, 1964-May 27, 1986.
    Microfilm available in Hornbake Library. AN41.16.A41
  • AAA - ProQuest Historical Newspapers: Baltimore Sun, the (1837-1986) (ProQuest XML)
    Provides complete issues of The Baltimore Sun from 1837-1985. Search by keyword and more....
  • AAA - ProQuest Historical Newspapers: The Washington Post (1877-1996) (ProQuest XML)
    The Washington Post (1877-1996) offers full page and article images with searchable full text back to the first issue. The collection includes digital reproductions providing access to every page from every available issue.
  • Washington Times
    Microfilm available in McKeldin Library. AN29 .W35
  • AAA - ProQuest Historical Newspapers: The Baltimore African-American (1893-1988) (ProQuest XML)
    The Baltimore Afro-American (1893-1988) offers full page and article images with searchable full text. The collection includes digital reproductions providing access to every page from every available issue.
  • AAA - ProQuest Historical Newspapers: The New York Times (1851-2008) (ProQuest XML)
    The New York Times Historical (1851-2007) offers full page and article images with searchable full text back to the first issue. The collection includes digital reproductions providing access to every page from every available issue.
  • AAA - ProQuest Historical Newspapers: Los Angeles Sentinel (1934-2005) (ProQuest XML)
